hook.text: You run a skincare brand. You could build a warehouse and hire drivers, or let FedEx handle it all.

buildup.text: Third-party logistics providers handle warehousing, shipping, and fulfillment so companies can focus on their core.

discovery.text: 3PLs offer economies of scale: they serve hundreds of clients, spreading fixed costs across many.

twist.text: Handing off logistics means handing off customer experience. If the 3PL ships late, your brand takes the blame.

climax.text: Amazon FBA (Fulfillment by Amazon) is the largest 3PL. Sellers pay Amazon to store, pick, pack, and deliver.

punchline.text: Outsource logistics. But never outsource accountability.

quiz.question: What is a third-party logistics (3PL) provider?
options: A company that handles warehousing, shipping, and fulfillment for other businesses
A government agency that regulates shipping
A factory that manufactures goods for other brands
